title: Windows XP SP3 VL (Updated September 2013)
description:
This is my own personal "creation".
I've used nLite to create this setup of Windows XP.

This is updated Windows SP3 until September 2013.


Removed components:
--Briefcase
--Defragmenter
--Internet Games
--Display Drivers
--Images and Backgrounds
--Luna desktop theme
--Music Samples
--Old CDPlayer and Sound Recorder
--MSN Explorer
--Windows Messenger
--Blaster/Nachi removal tool
--MS Agent
--Search Assistant
--Tour

Added components and software:
--Adobe ActiveX for IE
--MS Visual C++ Runtimes (All versions + Legacy)
--.Net Framework 1.1 + hotfixes
--.Net Framework 3.5 SP1Ã¢â‚¬Å¡(contains 2.0 and 3.0 + hotfixes)
--.Net Framework 4.0 + hotfixes


Themes (Official MS themes for XP):
--Royale + wallpaper
--Zune + wallpaper
--Embedded + wallpaper

Tweaks:
--Various tweaks for IE (google.com for homepage, popup blocker on high etc.)
--Various tweaks for WMP9 (disable starting in media guide, disable codec download etc.)

Various tweaks throughout whole system like adding FONTS folder into My Computer folder, adding shortcuts for CLEANUP, Add or Remove Programs, Device Manager into My Computer context menu.



Windows Media Player is definitelly faster than by default in WinXP.
IE6.....well use it only when you update Windows.

VL key is implemented into setup, so u don't need to type it.
Some minor tweaks throughout Windows setup itself.


Check it out, try it and let me know how u like it.
In my opinion, Windows XP should be something like this.

Updated, fast, with shortcuts for everything and everywhere without unusable components.



ISO is bootable, so just mount it and burn it down on regular CD or you can try it with VirtualBox or something similar.



Enjoy and seed!!!
